location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from His Excellency Lieutenant-Colonel Justin Sheil CB, Her Majesty's Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia, Tehran to Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire

mods.abstract: Justin Sheil refers to Samuel Hennell's despatch of 12 January 1850, no. 12, which requested permission to make a formal application to the authorities of Fars to recover twelve mule loads of raisins, which were plundered from Mr J Malcolm by the tribe of Khoda Kerreem Khan. Sheil informs Hennell that since the protection of the British Government has been extended to Malcolm, he [Malcolm] is entitled to whatever assistance Hennell can give him.
